item.title: U.S.-India Insight: Beyond Optics: India’s New Strategic-Commercial Linkages
item.description: As global alignments shift, India is quietly deepening trade and security ties with U.S. allies—even as high-profile engagements with rivals grab headlines. A closer look shows substance, not symbolism, is shaping India’s strategic direction.

item.title: SCOTUS Ruling and Korea
item.description: The Supreme Court’s ruling on the consolidated cases ofV.O.S. Selections, Inc. v. TrumpandLearning Resources, Inc. v. Trumpis expected tomorrow. Here are some key numbers to keep in mind with this impending decision.

item.title: CSIS Middle East Program Names Vali Nasr as Non-Resident Senior Adviser and Joseph Farsakh as Non-Resident Senior Associate
item.description: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) today announced the appointments of Vali Nasr as non-resident senior adviser and Joseph Farsakh as non-resident senior associate with the CSIS Middle East Program.

item.title: Why Losing Local Voices in Foreign Aid–Diplomacy Mergers Threatens National Security
item.description: Merging USAID’s functions with those of the State Department could weaken U.S. foreign policy, potentially reducing local input in the policymaking process and eroding access, context, and long-term relationships.
